intro: Agathosma propinqua, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow, aromatic, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Agathosma propinqua is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
